title: Escala poaches from Wilsons for new CIO
text:
Wealth management firm Escala Partners has hired Wilsons' head of asset allocation as its new chief investment officer.

It is understood Tracey McNaughton, who joined Wilsons from UBS Asset Management last year, will replace well-known investment strategist Giselle Roux.

Escala Partners has snared Tracey McNaughton, who brings 20-odd years’ experience and is well known within Australia and internationally for specialising in investment strategy, across both fixed income and multi-asset. Tanya Lake

It's a big hire for Escala which had been seeking to fill the chief investment officer role since Roux left earlier this year.

McNaughton brings 20-odd years’ experience to Escala, having held senior positions in investment strategy in Australia and offshore, across both fixed income and multi-asset.

McNaughton joined Wilsons last November from UBS where she was head of investment strategy.

Her remit saw her work across the Swiss bank's multi-asset, multi-manager funds, including research and analysis of external managers, portfolio construction and strategic asset allocation.
